intro: Cissampelos pata, commonly known as the African moon vine, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Its roots and leaves contain compounds with potential medicinal properties. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
